page.title: 14MELDON QUARRY
page.content: Meldon Quarry is on the edge of Dartmoor at around 300m above sea level. First opened by the London and South Western Railway it now supplies the southern part of the railway system with ballast to support the track. A single blast will produce some 40000 tonnes of loose rock which is then crushed to various sizes. The ballast is a nominal 50mm, while other smaller grits are also produced. Over 90% of the output is despatched by rail in five trains a day, each carrying around 1000 tonnes. Some stone is sold locally for road making and building purposes. Recently the future of the quarry, and its 60 jobs did not look good, but high speed railways demand ever larger amounts of ballast so the product is needed. Permission has been give to enlarge the working to give a 25 year future.
